decision_conditions: The proposed shop front by virtue of its design, illumination, material and appearance, represents an incongruous feature to the detriment of the visual amenity of the host building, streetscene and wider area. As such the proposal is contrary to policy D4 (Delivering good design) of the London Plan (2021), policy LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020) and the recommendations of the Hackney Shopfront Design Guide.

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-ceecec9a-7fff-1413-b306-1ab4c5cd3001"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The proposal, by reason of the introduction of a 24 hour operating use, and in the absence of a management plan to mitigate harmful amenity impacts, would give rise to unacceptable levels of noise, disturbance and anti social behaviour, to the detriment of the residential amenities of neighbouring occupiers. As such the proposal is contrary to policies D4 (Delivering good design) and D14 (Noise) of The London Plan (2021) and policies LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), LP2 (Development and Amenity), LP38 (Evening and Night Time Economy) and LP58 (Improving the Environment - Pollution) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020). </span></span><br></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-21775bd1-7fff-6e18-6d19-84b8f63bb99a"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The proposed change of use would create an over concentration of similar adult gambling shops within this area, which would have a detrimental impact on the vitality and viability of the area and is harmful to the health and wellbeing and amenity of the community and other stakeholders. Particularly in the absence of a Health Impact Assessment to demonstrate how the scheme will manage social impacts of gambling.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">As such, the proposal is contrary to policy SD6 (Town centres and high streets) of the London Plan (2021) and policies LP9 (Health and Wellbeing), LP38 (Evening and Night Time Economy) and LP39 (Overconcentration of Uses) of Hackney Local Plan (2020</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">).</span></p>
description: Change of use from a stationary shop (Class E) to an adult gaming centre (Sui Generis), together with shopfront alterations (in connection with advertisement consent Ref.2023/0924).

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: A4D Storage and distribution to residential
